page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: About half of our area is open country and most of the rest could be described as suburban residential. It is almost on the edge of the Edinburgh city boundary and it is well served for fast access to the town centre by road, while still affording quick access to the airport, part of which lies within our Domesday Block. Many of the houses are built on a hill and have interesting views over to the Forth Road and Railway Bridges to the north. People coming to the capital city from the west and north of Scotland pass through this block. Most of the houses have been built in the last 50 years, and some building is still going on where there is land available for the purpose. Most of the shops are in the main street of Corstorphine, which used to be a village.
